awd_titl_txt: Scope and Mechanism(s) of Catalysis by Glycosylases
awd_abstract_narration: The objective of this grant is to elucidate the mechanisms of                   action of certain glycosidase enzymes.  It has been found                       that a fungal alpha-glucosidase can convert beta-D-glucosyl                     fluoride to alpha-D-glucose.  The proposed research will 1)                     determine whether this unusual catalytic process occurs at                      the same site as natural alpha-D-glucosies, 20 ascertain                        whether other glucoisdases react with the wrong anomer and if                   so 3) examine their stereochemistries, rates and mechanisms.                    In addition, the 3 dimensional structure of soybean beta-                       amylase will be determined by X-ray crystallography.                                                                                                            Enzymes catalyse almost all the reaction that take place in a                   living organism.  This research will enhance our                                understanding of not only the mechanism of action of                            glucosidases but also the basic principles which underlie                       enzyme catalysis at the molecular level.
org_div_long_name: Division of Molecular and Cellular Biosciences

inst.inst_name: Yeshiva University, Albert Einstein College of Medicine
